name: Threat Assessment Models
description: Frameworks for evaluating potential security threats based on intelligence data.

cards.title: Link Analysis & Network Mapping
cards.description: Connecting data points to uncover hidden relationships.
bulletpoints: Use network graph visualization tools to reveal associations between individuals, groups, and assets
Analyze communications and financial transactions to identify covert networks
Assess degrees of separation to detect central figures and hidden influencers within a threat network
cards.summaryText: Map relational data to surface covert networks and spotlight pivotal actors for disruption.

cards.title: Behavioral Risk Analysis & Predictive Profiling
cards.description: Evaluating behavioral trends to predict potential threats.
bulletpoints: Identify pre-incident indicators by analyzing deviations from normal activity patterns
Assess psychological and ideological motivations behind potential threat actors
Use historical case studies to refine predictive threat models and escalation pathways
cards.summaryText: Profile behavioral indicators and motivations to forecast which actors are most likely to escalate.

cards.title: Attack Surface Analysis & Vulnerability Assessment
cards.description: Identifying weaknesses that adversaries could exploit.
bulletpoints: Map out physical, cyber, and human vulnerabilities in an organization's security infrastructure
Assess potential entry points that adversaries could use to launch an attack
Develop mitigation strategies to reduce the likelihood of exploitation
cards.summaryText: Survey physical, cyber, and human gaps to flag exploitable entry points and prioritize hardening.

cards.title: Threat Vector Modeling & Adversarial Tactics
cards.description: Evaluating the methods adversaries use to conduct attacks.
bulletpoints: Analyze past attack methodologies to predict future threats
Use the MITRE ATT&CK framework to classify adversary tactics and techniques
Develop response plans based on known adversarial capabilities and motivations
cards.summaryText: Classify adversary playbooks with ATT&CK to anticipate tactics and tailor proactive responses.

cards.title: Risk Mitigation Strategies & Intelligence-Based Decision Making
cards.description: Creating security policies based on threat intelligence assessments.
bulletpoints: Prioritize threats based on likelihood, impact, and available countermeasures
Use intelligence-driven risk scoring models to refine security policies
Integrate real-time threat intelligence feeds into proactive decision-making
cards.summaryText: Rank threats by impact and fuse live intel feeds to drive adaptive, evidence-based policies.
